QUESTION.QUESTION_INSTRUCTION:
Please code java program as per the instructions provided in the comments in right hand section

  • Do NOT change the name of the class or method provided in the code

  • Make sure the code gets compiled properly before the final submission. Any compilation error would be displayed on your screen, when you execute the program

  • You are expected to write all your test inputs in main method and test your code before submission


Please ensure that the code you submit is professionally written i.e.



  • Add necessary checks for bad input e.g. null/ empty check, test for not null, zero input etc

  • Add proper comments

  • Perform appropriate exception handling whereever needed

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void countWordsTest1(){ assertEquals(4,countWords("This is my world"));}
@Test public void countWordsTest3(){ try{countWords(null);} catch(NullPointerException e){ assertTrue(false);}}
@Test public void countWordsTest5(){ assertEquals(5,countWords("This is my world www"));}

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: How does session management work between Browser and Java application server (Tomcat). Please mark which of the below statements are true

OPTIONS.OPTION: Session is created by the server and is maintained by the server
Server maps each http request coming from the browser to a session using IP address of computer where request is coming from
Server maps each http request coming from browser using session Id sent in the request by the browser
Server send the session id back to browser as part of http response
Browser generates the session id and sends it to server
When one thread is executing X.f1(), another thread can execute X.f2() at the same time (concurrently)
When one thread is executing X.f1(), another thread can NOT execute X.f2() concurrently
When X.f1() is executed, to synchronize the method JVM acquires lock on Class X
When X.f1() is executed, to synchronize the method JVM acquires lock on method f1()

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: How is DNS (Domain name server) used

OPTIONS.OPTION: DNS converts domain name (website name) to IP address
DNS gives domain names to IP address of various websites
Browser sends the HTTP request to DNS and DNS sends the request to website server after converting it to ip address
Browser sends a DNS query to DNS, gets IP address back from DNS and using that IP address sends a HTTP request to website server
Browser sends the HTTP request to website and your ISP (Internet service provider) uses DNS to send that request to website server
